intro: Lissocarpa guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan lissocarpa, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly found in countries like Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically pinnately compound, with a feathery appearance. Lissocarpa guianensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
